group_1.textRight: What're you and Madoka doin', Tsuruno?

group_1.textLeft: Our contribution is...

group_1.textRight: Otsukimi!

group_1.textLeft: Otsukimi...?

group_1.textRight: Yep, looking at the moon!

group_1.textLeft: Ah...speaking of, even though it's Otsukimi, we@haven't actually done any moon viewing, have we...

group_1.textRight: Now that you mention it... We forgot@the most important part.

group_1.textLeft: So, that means we're...looking at the moon!

group_1.textRight: Alright... Start!
...Hey, how long we gotta look up?

group_1.textLeft: Mmm... Are you bored already?

group_1.textRight: All we're doin' is lookin' at the moon...
Sorry... I'm also kind of...
To be honest...

group_1.textLeft: This is the long-awaited Otsukimi,
so I think it's good to set some time aside@for moon viewing...

group_1.textRight: You're right, it's Otsukimi, so we should@enjoy the moon...!

group_1.textLeft: Though I don't think Felicia would@appreciate it...
Sitting still isn't her strong suit, you see...

group_1.textRight: Ahaha... Not her strong suit...

group_1.textLeft: ...It's a shame, but could we make it@more active?

group_1.textRight: Hmm... In that case, what do you think@of this?

group_1.textLeft: So it's not just any moon viewing.
Did you come up with an idea then,@Madoka...?

group_1.textRight: Yep.
It's not about just looking at it,@but changing your perspective of it.

group_1.textLeft: Changing our perspective?

group_1.textRight: The moon is always there,
but you never get to really take your time@to look at it, right?
So I thought it would be a good idea to@get a closer look.

group_1.textLeft: In other words, we're going to look at@the moon in a new light!
We're always loo~king at the moon without@ever thinking about it,
but don't you think we'd find something@new about it if we took a clo~ser look?

group_1.textRight: ...Is that how that works?

group_1.textLeft: Come on, act like you've fallen for it here!
*Giggle* Why not? This could be amusing.

group_1.textRight: Hmm...I'll give it a shot...

group_1.textLeft: Um... Do we just wait and stare at it?

group_1.textRight: Before that, first you have to close your eyes.

group_1.narration: "Then...picture the moon that everyone@knows in your minds..."
"...Huh? Trying to picture it again@might be a little difficult..."
"It is, isn't it...@Umm...first of all, it's round...@And the rabbit is there..."
"Haha, you don't know, Sana?@That ain't a real rabbit; Kako told me so!"
"There is a pattern of a rabbit, though...@That's why in Japan...it is said that@rabbits live on the moon..."
"There is also...@an image of a gentle smile."
"Ah, there's that...@'Sleep under the moon as it watches@over you with a gentle smile.'@...Or something like that in fairy tales, right?"
"Hmm... Everyone's got their own@different image of it. The only thing I can think@is that it's full and empty."
"...Today is Otsukimi, so I'm only@now thinking of the full moon, but it's@reminded me - Mikazuki is also a moon, isn't it..."
"Mikazuki Villa!@Watchin' the moon's perfect for us!"
"Okay, it's time to open your eyes."
"Now compare it to the real moon!"

group_1.textLeft: Huh...?

group_1.textRight: There is no...rabbit...
Yes...there isn't a rabbit pattern, is there...

group_1.textLeft: Speakin' of... It looks like a person's face.

group_1.textRight: ...But, it's not so much as smiling as...

group_1.textLeft: It's grinning.
Yeah...how should I put it...@It feels a little creepy...?

group_1.textRight: But a gentle smile was how I imagined it.
Looking at it closely, it's different...

group_1.textLeft: But...
Doesn't it look like it's watching over us,@kind of...?

group_1.textRight: It is a moon viewing party,
so maybe the moon also wanted to@participate?

group_1.textLeft: How curious... I wonder if it wants to@have fun with us.
If it does, I'm more than happy!

group_1.textRight: It's just like Tsuruno 'n Madoka said -@we discovered all kindsa stuff!

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad everyone got to enjoy it, and@it's all thanks to Madoka!
Madoka...? What's up?

group_1.textRight: Umm...it is true that the Otsukimi pattern@isn't a rabbit,
and I've heard that in some countries@it's described more as a crab...
But still... Is it really that weird...?

group_1.textLeft: Is it weird...?
